com.yantra.api.wms.laneassignment

Interface assignLane

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.WMSApi, YIFApi

    public interface assignLane

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document assignLane(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The assignLane API assigns lanes to the shipments in a Wave based on the sort strategy that has been configured.

    • Method Detail

      • assignLane

        org.w3c.dom.Document assignLane(YFSEnvironment env,
                                org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                         throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                java.rmi.RemoteException

        The assignLane API assigns lanes to the shipments in a Wave based on the sort strategy that has been configured. Upon completion, it changes the wave status based on the drop status that has been configured for the 'ASSIGN_LANE" transaction. The processing logic of this API can be summarized as follows:

        1. Based on the Shipment Group of the Wave and the ship node, the Sort Strategy is chosen.
        2. Depending on the sort strategy, lanes are assigned based on two strategies (SortByCarrier and/or SortByShipment)
        3. If dedicated chutes have been configured , lanes are assigned based on these dedicated chutes. The dedicated chutes are selected and assigned in the priority of Scac on the shipment, International Shipments, Pack And Hold Shipments and single container shipments.
        4. If there are still shipments with unassigned lanes, lanes are assigned based on the equipment locations that have been configured for the sort strategy (shipment or carrier sort).
        5. In case of carrier sort, first look for a lane which has other shipments with a matching SCAC (SCAC on the shipments that are already assigned to this lane should match the SCAC on the shipment for which lane needs to be assigned) and the equipment's capacity volume should not exceed the utilized volume of the equipment.
          If a lane was found, then stamp the location id of the equipment as the carrier sort location id on the shipment.
          If no lane was found with the matching criteria,then continue with steps 6 - 9 which are common to both Shipment and carrier sort.
        6. Pick up a shipment with an unassigned lane and try to find an empty lane for that shipment.
        7. If no empty lane was found, then try to find a lane which has other shipments with a matching SCAC (SCAC on the shipments that are already assigned to this lane should match the SCAC on the shipment for which lane needs to be assigned).
        8. If no lane was found in the previous step, then try to find a lane with the least utilized volume. The utilized volume for a lane is computed as the
          sum of all the shipment's volume that have assigned to that lane.
        9. If a lane was found, then stamp the location id of the equipment on the Shipment Sort Location Id in case of shipment sort.
          In case of carrier sort,stamp the location id on the carrier sort location id in the shipment.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
        com.yantra.wms.japi.ue.WMSOverrideAssignLaneUE

        Events Raised:

        ON_SUCCESS:
        This event is raised upon successful execution of the API.
        Data published - WMS_ASSIGN_LANE.ON_SUCCESS.xml
        Key data - wave_dbd.txt

        HAS_EXCEPTIONS:
        This event is raised when lanes are not assigned to one or more shipments belonging to the wave.
        Data published - WMS_ASSIGN_LANE.HAS_EXCEPTIONS.xml

        Template Support: Yes

        Configuration Required for backward compatibility: No

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: No

        Database Extensibility Support: No

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.
        Returns:
        An XML document. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException
        java.rmi.RemoteException
